citations.narrative:
The Continency Plan has not been reviewed by the research facility on at least an annual basis. The last review of the
Contingency Plan was completed more than one year ago prior to the April 2023 inspection.
Per this Section, all research facilities must review their Continency Plan on at least an annual basis to ensure that it
adequately addresses potential emergency situations that could be detrimental to the health and well-being of the
animals. The research facility needs to review the Contingency Plan and needs to maintain documentation of all annual
reviews of the Plan. Correct by 9/2/24.

The following general housekeeping issues were noted during the inspection of OR #1, OR #2, and Prep Room #1. The
last time these rooms were used for procedures with animals was either several days ago or more than one week ago.
There were various types of soiled equipment present on counters and tables in the rooms that were used the last time
procedures were performed there, the counters and floors were soiled, there were full trash receptacles, and the rooms
were cluttered in appearance.
Per this Section, premises shall be kept clean to facilitate the prescribed husbandry practices and to protect the health of
the animals. These rooms need to be cleaned and the level of housekeeping needs to be improved. The research facility
corrected this item during the inspection by thoroughly cleaning the 3 rooms. To remain corrected from this date 8/1/24
forward.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.38(l)(2) 
   
Miscellaneous. 
The Continency Plan has not been reviewed by the research facility on at least an annual basis. The last review of the 
Contingency Plan was completed more than one year ago prior to the April 2023 inspection.  
 
Per this Section, all research facilities must review their Continency Plan on at least an annual basis to ensure that it 
adequately addresses potential emergency situations that could be detrimental to the health and well-being of the 
animals. The research facility needs to review the Contingency Plan and needs to maintain documentation of all annual 
reviews of the Plan. Correct by 9/2/24. 
3.131(c) 
   
Sanitation. 
The following general housekeeping issues were noted during the inspection of OR #1, OR #2, and Prep Room #1. The 
last time these rooms were used for procedures with animals was either several days ago or more than one week ago. 
There were various types of soiled equipment present on counters and tables in the rooms that were used the last time 
procedures were performed there, the counters and floors were soiled, there were full trash receptacles, and the rooms 
were cluttered in appearance.  
 
Per this Section, premises shall be kept clean to facilitate the prescribed husbandry practices and to protect the health of 
the animals. These rooms need to be cleaned and the level of housekeeping needs to be improved. The research facility 
corrected this item during the inspection by thoroughly cleaning the 3 rooms. To remain corrected from this date 8/1/24 
forward. 
 
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representative. 
 
 n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
